meanings.definition: Test (something, especially a new product) to assess its suitability or performance.
meanings.sent1: The scientists trialled the new medicine on mice to see if it was safe.
meanings.sent2: She trial led the latest software update to check for any bugs.
meanings.sent3: The chef trialled a strange combination of ingredients in the recipe, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The coach trialled a new strategy in the game, surprising everyone with its effectiveness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher trialled a new teaching method that made learning more engaging for the students.

meanings.sent1: The judge trial led the suspect to determine their guilt or innocence.
meanings.sent2: They trial led the accused criminal in a fair and just manner.
meanings.sent3: The kids trial led their friend in a pretend court for breaking the imaginary rules.
meanings.sent4: The committee trial led the new member to see if they would fit in with the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher trial led the students to a pop quiz to assess their understanding of the lesson.

meanings.definition: Attempt or test out (a new method or idea).
meanings.sent1: She trial led a different approach to solving the math problem and found it much easier.
meanings.sent2: The company trial led a unique marketing strategy to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: He trial led a bizarre way of tying his shoelaces just to see if it would work.
meanings.sent4: The team trial led a fresh tactic in the game, surprising their opponents.
meanings.sent5: The students trial led a creative way to present their project, impressing their classmates.
